meanings.sent1: The sky looked grayish before the storm.
meanings.sent2: Her cat has a grayish fur coat.
meanings.sent3: The grayish clouds seemed to be playing hide and seek with the sun.
meanings.sent4: The old building had a grayish facade, blending into the urban landscape.
meanings.sent5: The grayish mist enveloped the forest, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The paint on the walls had started to look grayish over time.
meanings.sent2: His hair was turning grayish at the temples.
meanings.sent3: The grayish shadows in the room made it feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a grayish palette to convey a sense of melancholy in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The grayish hue of the mountains in the distance gave them a mystical quality.
